CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A novel conjugated polymer of PBDT-TDPP-S was synthesized , which contains a donor unit of benzo [1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene in main chain and an acceptor unit of diketopyrrolopyrrole in side chain. This kind of side - chain donor - acceptor ( D-A ) polymer exhibited better solution processability , lower HOMO level ( -5.34 eV ) , and more balanced carrier mobility relative to its corresponding mainchain D-A conjugated polymers. Using PBDT-TDPP-S as electron donor and [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptor , the resulting polymer solar cells exhibited outstanding photovoltaic properties with a power conversion efficiency of 4.89% , an open - circuit voltage of 0.84 V , a short - circuit current of 10.04 mA cm^-2 , and a fill factor of 56.0% . Bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) have attracted significant attention because of their potential for achieving large - area , flexible photovoltaic devices through lowcost solution processing techniques. 1 To date , solar power conversion efficiencies ( PCE ) of 10.6% and 9.2% have been demonstrated in the cells with tandem and single junction structures , respectively , representing an important advance in the development of PSCs. 2 Many recent research efforts have been concentrated on the development of donor - acceptor ( D-A ) narrow band gap ( NBG ) polymers with broad absorption spectra. 3 Despite the great success of these D-A polymers in achieving high performance PSCs , further development of novel electron donor polymers is still in urgent need as the donor polymers play a decisive role in determining the device performance. Nowadays , most of the present polymers are in main - chain D-A frame , which may suffer from lower hole mobility due to the influence of acceptor units in the main chain. Aiming at investigating the effects of the D-A framework on device performance , Huang and co-workers proposed a new molecular design strategy toward side - chain D-A conjugated polymers , in which D moieties were employed to construct the main chain and A units were conjugatedly pended onto the D units in the side chain. 4 Compared to the corresponding main - chain D-A polymers , the side - chain ones mainly possesses three advantages. First , the highest occupied molecular orbit ( HOMO ) energy levels of the side - chain polymers can preserve in a deeper position. Second , a two - dimensional - like structural feature renders this class of polymers with better solubility. Finally , there exists an internal charge transfer ( ICT ) behavior from the side - chain D-A structure , which can fine - tune the band gap ( E g ) of the resultant polymers as well as promote an isotropic charge transport along the polymeric main chain. As a result of these merits , PSCs based on these previously reported side - chain D-A polymers exhibited a maximal PCE of 4.74% .

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. PBDT-TDPP-S: This is a conjugated polymer containing a donor unit of benzo [1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene in the main chain and an acceptor unit of diketopyrrolopyrrole in the side chain.
2. PC71BM: This is an electron acceptor used in the synthesis of the PBDT-TDPP-S polymer.
3. [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester: This is the electron acceptor used in the synthesis of the PBDT-TDPP-S polymer.
4. BHJ: This stands for bulk heterojunction, which refers to the type of polymer solar cells (PSCs) that are being developed.
5. PCE: This stands for power conversion efficiency, which is a measure of the efficiency of the solar cells in converting sunlight into electrical energy.
6. tandem and single junction structures: These refer to the different types of solar cell structures that are being developed, with tandem structures having multiple layers of donor and acceptor materials and single junction structures having a single layer of donor and acceptor materials.
7. D-A polymers: This stands for donor-acceptor polymers, which are a type of conjugated polymer that is being developed for solar cells.
8. NBG polymers: This stands for narrow band gap polymers, which are a type of conjugated polymer that is being developed for solar cells.
9. HOMO: This stands for highest occupied molecular orbital, which is a measure of the energy level of the highest occupied molecular orbitals in the polymer.
10. LOMO: This stands for lowest unoccupied molecular orbital, which is a measure of the energy level of the lowest unoccupied molecular orbitals in the polymer.
11. ICT: This stands for internal charge transfer, which is a phenomenon that occurs in some conjugated polymers where the charge transfer between the donor and acceptor units results in a fine-tuned band gap and improved charge transport.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the entities that clearly refer to "Material Name" in the provided text:

1. PBDT-TDPP-S
2. PC71BM

These are the only entities in the text that are directly related to the concept of "Material Name".

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities related to "Material Name" in the provided paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PBDT-TDPP-S |
| PC71BM |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A novel conjugated polymer of PBDT-TDPP-S was synthesized , which contains a donor unit of benzo [1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene in main chain and an acceptor unit of diketopyrrolopyrrole in side chain. This kind of side - chain donor - acceptor ( D-A ) polymer exhibited better solution processability , lower HOMO level ( -5.34 eV ) , and more balanced carrier mobility relative to its corresponding mainchain D-A conjugated polymers. Using PBDT-TDPP-S as electron donor and [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptor , the resulting polymer solar cells exhibited outstanding photovoltaic properties with a power conversion efficiency of 4.89% , an open - circuit voltage of 0.84 V , a short - circuit current of 10.04 mA cm^-2 , and a fill factor of 56.0% . Bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) have attracted significant attention because of their potential for achieving large - area , flexible photovoltaic devices through lowcost solution processing techniques. 1 To date , solar power conversion efficiencies ( PCE ) of 10.6% and 9.2% have been demonstrated in the cells with tandem and single junction structures , respectively , representing an important advance in the development of PSCs. 2 Many recent research efforts have been concentrated on the development of donor - acceptor ( D-A ) narrow band gap ( NBG ) polymers with broad absorption spectra. 3 Despite the great success of these D-A polymers in achieving high performance PSCs , further development of novel electron donor polymers is still in urgent need as the donor polymers play a decisive role in determining the device performance. Nowadays , most of the present polymers are in main - chain D-A frame , which may suffer from lower hole mobility due to the influence of acceptor units in the main chain. Aiming at investigating the effects of the D-A framework on device performance , Huang and co-workers proposed a new molecular design strategy toward side - chain D-A conjugated polymers , in which D moieties were employed to construct the main chain and A units were conjugatedly pended onto the D units in the side chain. 4 Compared to the corresponding main - chain D-A polymers , the side - chain ones mainly possesses three advantages. First , the highest occupied molecular orbit ( HOMO ) energy levels of the side - chain polymers can preserve in a deeper position. Second , a two - dimensional - like structural feature renders this class of polymers with better solubility. Finally , there exists an internal charge transfer ( ICT ) behavior from the side - chain D-A structure , which can fine - tune the band gap ( E g ) of the resultant polymers as well as promote an isotropic charge transport along the polymeric main chain. As a result of these merits , PSCs based on these previously reported side - chain D-A polymers exhibited a maximal PCE of 4.74% .

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the property names of materials mentioned in the paragraph:

1. PBDT-TDPP-S:
 * Property name: Electron donor
 * Explanation: PBDT-TDPP-S is a conjugated polymer used as an electron donor in the synthesis of the novel conjugated polymer.
2. [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM):
 * Property name: Electron acceptor
 * Explanation: PC71BM is a conjugated polymer used as an electron acceptor in the synthesis of the novel conjugated polymer.
3. Bulk heterojunction (BHJ) polymer solar cells (PSCs):
 * Property name: Photovoltaic device structure
 * Explanation: BHJ PSCs are a type of photovoltaic device structure that consists of a bulk heterojunction between two conjugated polymers.
4. Tandem and single junction structures:
 * Property name: Photovoltaic device structure
 * Explanation: Tandem and single junction structures are different types of photovoltaic device structures that are used to achieve high power conversion efficiency.
5. Donor-acceptor (D-A) polymers:
 * Property name: Class of polymers
 * Explanation: D-A polymers are a class of conjugated polymers that consist of a donor unit and an acceptor unit in a side chain.
6. Narrow band gap (NBG) polymers:
 * Property name: Class of polymers
 * Explanation: NBG polymers are a class of conjugated polymers with a narrow band gap, which is desirable for photovoltaic applications.
7. Highest occupied molecular orbit (HOMO) energy levels:
 * Property name: Energy level
 * Explanation: HOMO energy levels are the highest energy levels in a molecule or material, which are important for determining the electronic properties of the material.
8. Open-circuit voltage (Voc):
 * Property name: Voltage
 * Explanation: Voc is the voltage at which the current density is zero in a photovoltaic device, and it is an important parameter for determining the device's efficiency.
9. Short-circuit current (Jsc):
 * Property name: Current
 * Explanation: Jsc is the maximum current that can be obtained in a photovoltaic device under short-circuit conditions, and it is an important parameter for determining the device's efficiency.
10. Fill factor (FF):
 * Property name: Factor
 * Explanation: FF is a measure of the efficiency of a photovoltaic device, and it is calculated as the ratio of the product of the Jsc and Voc to the product of the short-circuit current density and the open-circuit voltage.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Sure, here are the relevant entities that refer to the property name of a material:

1. PBDT-TDPP-S: Property name of the conjugated polymer used as an electron donor in the synthesis of the novel conjugated polymer.
2. PC71BM: Property name of the conjugated polymer used as an electron acceptor in the synthesis of the novel conjugated polymer.
3. HOMO energy levels: Property name of the highest occupied molecular orbitals in a material, which determine the electronic properties of the material.
4. Voc: Property name of the open-circuit voltage in a photovoltaic device, which is an important parameter for determining the device's efficiency.
5. Jsc: Property name of the short-circuit current in a photovoltaic device, which is an important parameter for determining the device's efficiency.
6. FF: Property name of the fill factor in a photovoltaic device, which is a measure of the efficiency of the device.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| PC71BM |
| HOMO energy levels |

1. Values of electron donor and acceptor units:

2. HOMO level:

3. Carrier mobility:

4. Power conversion efficiency (PCE):
